translation: Sutra on the Girl Rangdhari

source_sentence: 唐三藏沙門大廣智不空奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by the imperial order of the Tang tripiṭaka monk, Dagong Zhi Bukong
Thus I've heard.
One time, the Bhagavān was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 住舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: He was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 與大苾芻眾千二百五十人俱。
translation: He was accompanied by a great congregation of twelve hundred and fifty monks.
There were also measureless bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and gods, dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, kiṃnaras, and other gods.

source_sentence: 及諸天龍藥叉乾闥婆阿修羅迦樓羅緊那羅摩睺羅伽人非人等皆來集會。
translation: There were gods, dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, humans, and nonhumans all gathered here.
It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks.
"I'm mindful of the past.
I was staying north of Mount Snowdon and traveling up Fragrant Drunkenness Mountain.
I saw a young woman.
She had a body adorned with the appearance of a hundred blessings.

source_sentence: 鹿皮為衣以諸毒蛇而為瓔珞。
translation: Deer skin was made into a robe, and she wore a necklace made of venomous snakes.
She gathered various venomous insects and vipers.
She's surrounded by them and always playing with them.
She drinks poisonous juice and eats poisonous fruit.
When that woman saw me, she said.

source_sentence: 仁者當知聽我宣說穰麌梨真言。
translation: "Sir, you should know that you've heard me preach the true words of Rang stagri.
It's able to remove all the poisons of the world.
If someone hears this true teaching ...
He'll bear my name.
They won't be harmed by all the poisons.'
The young girl then taught it for me.
After I heard it from that girl, I always maintained this teaching for the benefit of sentient beings.
I'll always maintain this teaching for the benefit of sentient beings.
Now, I'll say this true saying.

source_sentence: 怛儞也(二合)他(去聲引)唵(引)壹里蜜帝(引一)底(丁以切)里蜜帝(引二)壹里底里蜜帝(引三)努(鼻)迷努(鼻)麼(引)里(引)曳(平聲引四)訥泚訥蹉(去聲引)里(引)曳(平聲五)得羯囉抳(尼呈切鼻六)嚩(無博切)羯囉抳(鼻上同七)羯濕弭(二合引)[口*(隸-木+士)](引八)羯濕弭(二合引)囉穆訖帝(二合引九)惡祇(祇曳切十)惡伽(去聲)寧(十一)惡伽(去聲)曩伽寧(十二)壹里曳(十三)壹里壹里(引)曳(十四)阿(上聲)佉(去聲引)夜(引)曳(平聲十五)姶(烏合切)播(引)夜(引)曳(平聲十六)濕吠(二合引)帝(引十七)濕吠(二合引)多頓嬭(引十八)阿(上)曩(引)努(鼻)囉乞曬(二合引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(十九)佛告諸苾芻。
translation: 怛儞也(二合)他(去聲引)唵(引)壹里蜜帝(引一)底(丁以切)里蜜帝(引二)壹里底里蜜帝(引三)努(鼻)迷努(鼻)麼(引)里(引)曳(平聲引四)訥泚訥蹉(去聲引)里(引)曳(平聲五)得羯囉抳(尼呈切鼻六)嚩(無博切)羯囉抳(鼻上同七)羯濕弭(二合引)[口*(隸-木+士)](引八)羯濕弭(二合引)囉穆訖帝(二合引九)惡祇(祇曳切十)惡伽(去聲)寧(十一)惡伽(去聲)曩伽寧(十二)壹里曳(十三)壹里壹里(引)曳(十四)阿(上聲)佉(去聲引)夜(引)曳(平聲十五)姶(烏合切)播(引)夜(引)曳(平聲十六)濕吠(二合引)帝(引十七)濕吠(二合引)多頓嬭(引十八)阿(上)曩(引)努(鼻)囉乞曬(二合引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(十九)佛告諸苾芻。
"Suppose a person hears the dhāraṇī for seven years.

source_sentence: 却後七年遠離一切諸毒。
translation: After seven years, he'll be freed from all poisons.
If he always retains it, then all poisonous insects and other poisonous medicines will be present.

source_sentence: 一切毒蟲及諸毒藥悉不能害。
translation: All venomous insects and poisonous medicines won't harm him.
If a viper comes along and torments that person, his head is broken into seven parts like an orchid.

source_sentence: 頭破作七分猶如蘭香[卄/梢]。
translation: His head will be broken into seven parts like [twenty/tips of] orchid incense.
Anyone who accepts and retains this true teaching should first make an offering of something white to his teacher.
They should first make an offering of something white to their teacher.
Then, he'll surely attain success in upholding it.
Bhikṣu, you should know this.
Don't recite this teaching in front of a snake.
The snake will surely die.
You should recite this verbal expression.
Give the dead snake blessings to help it revive.
The true saying is.

source_sentence: 怛儞也(二合)他(去聲引一)唵(引)壹羅(引二)尾羅(引三)斫句(引)嚩句(去聲引四)句(引)拏(引)句嬭(引)底(丁以切五)報(引)拏(引)報(引)嬭(引)底(同前)[寧*頁]矩嚕拏(引六)[寧*頁]矩魯嬭(引)底(同前七)普吒囉蒵(引)普吒囉蒵(引八)普吒赧(讁簡切)拏囉蒵(引九)薩跛囉蒵(引十)薩跛吒赧(准上音)拏囉蒵(引十一)曩(引)誐囉蒵(引十二)曩(引)誐吒赧(同前)拏囉蒵(引十三)阿(上)泚(引)蹉禮(引十四)揆攞尾曬(引十五)試(引)帝(引)試(引)多嚩寧(引十六)滿跢(引)黎(引十七)伊(上)里黎(引十八)賀黎賀黎(十九)旦嬭(引)旦嬭(引二十)怛[齒*來](二十一)娑普(二合)吒娑普(二合)吒娑嚩(二合)賀(引二十二)爾時世尊說此陀羅尼已。
translation: 怛儞也(二合)他(去聲引一)唵(引)壹羅(引二)尾羅(引三)斫句(引)嚩句(去聲引四)句(引)拏(引)句嬭(引)底(丁以切五)報(引)拏(引)報(引)嬭(引)底(同前)[寧*頁]矩嚕拏(引六)[寧*頁]矩魯嬭(引)底(同前七)普吒囉蒵(引)普吒囉蒵(引八)普吒赧(讁簡切)拏囉蒵(引九)薩跛囉蒵(引十)薩跛吒赧(准上音)拏囉蒵(引十一)曩(引)誐囉蒵(引十二)曩(引)誐吒赧(同前)拏囉蒵(引十三)阿(上)泚(引)蹉禮(引十四)揆攞尾曬(引十五)試(引)帝(引)試(引)多嚩寧(引十六)滿跢(引)黎(引十七)伊(上)里黎(引十八)賀黎賀黎(十九)旦嬭(引)旦嬭(引二十)怛[齒*來](二十一)娑普(二合)吒娑普(二合)吒娑嚩(二合)賀(引二十二)爾時世尊說此陀羅尼已。
He told the monks.

source_sentence: 我此真言能解世間一切諸毒。
translation: "This true teaching of mine is an antidote to all the poisons of the world.

source_sentence: 蟲毒魅毒蠱毒藥毒等不能為害。
translation: It can't harm insects, poison, phantoms, poison, compulsions, medicines, or anything else.
If someone is poisoned, then they'll be saved with this true teaching.

source_sentence: 以此真言加持皆得消滅。
translation: When this true teaching is applied, it will all go away.'

source_sentence: 諸苾芻此穰麌梨陀羅尼。
translation: "Instructors, this is the dhāraṇī of Rāṅgulimālya.
It's spoken in the assembly of all the tathāgatas.
"It's true, not false, and not mistaken speech.

source_sentence: 如語不異語諸有藥毒呪毒蟲毒魅毒。
translation: It's just like the words and doesn't differ from the words of other beings who are poisoned by medicine, poisoned by spells, poisoned by insects, poisoned by demons, and poisoned by worms.
They want to inflict harm on each other.
They can cause them to abandon what they were given.

source_sentence: 令使諸毒入水入火入柱入壁。
translation: It causes those poisons to enter water, fire, pillars, and walls.
It also causes them to enter the ground.
All those poisons won't be made into poisons.
They're all capable of being removed.

source_sentence: 若人受持此經日誦一遍。
translation: If a person accepts this sūtra and recites it once a day, that person won't only extinguish the poisons of the world.
Not only does it extinguish the poisons of the world, but it also removes the three poisons in his body.
It also removes the three poisons in his body.
It was then that the Bhagavān addressed this topic.

source_sentence: 復說穰麌梨童女隨心真言及成就法。
translation: He also explained the true teaching and accomplishment method for the young woman Rang stagri to follow his heart.
A practitioner who wants to achieve this accomplishment must first cut out the five spices and stop eating salt.

source_sentence: 先斷五辛亦不食鹽不食油。
translation: First, he stops eating the five spices, doesn't eat salt, and doesn't eat oil.
He stops speaking and goes to one pure place.
He washes himself three times and changes his clothes three times.

source_sentence: 結印誦隨心真言滿一萬遍。
translation: He sets his seal and recites the true words of the followers' minds 10,000 times.
Then his practice will be complete.

source_sentence: 復作一切事必獲成就隨心真言曰。
translation: Again, whatever he does will be accomplished, according to the true chant.

source_sentence: 唵(引)阿(上聲)枲(思以切)爾賀(二合引一)戌(引)攞爾賀吠(二合引)嚩囉(二合)迦(引)臾(引三)仡囉(三合)娑仡囉(二合)娑(四)入嚩(二合)羅入嚩(二合)羅(五)摩賀(引)迦(引)里(六)摩賀(引)喻祇(霓夷切引七)濕嚩(二合)里(引)曳(引八)唵(引)頗[齒*來](引九)普吒囉奚(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引十)吽癹吒(上半聲)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引十一)我今復說穰虞梨印及觀行法。
translation: 唵(引)阿(上聲)枲(思以切)爾賀(二合引一)戌(引)攞爾賀吠(二合引)嚩囉(二合)迦(引)臾(引三)仡囉(三合)娑仡囉(二合)娑(四)入嚩(二合)羅入嚩(二合)羅(五)摩賀(引)迦(引)里(六)摩賀(引)喻祇(霓夷切引七)濕嚩(二合)里(引)曳(引八)唵(引)頗[齒*來](引九)普吒囉奚(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引十)吽癹吒(上半聲)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引十一)我今復說穰虞梨印及觀行法。
It's a fundamental seal.
He uses his second hand to wrestle with each other like he's scooping up something.
Putting his two pinkies together, he spreads out the other eight fingers and slightly bends them.

source_sentence: 餘八指各散開微曲即成。
translation: The other eight fingers are spread apart and slightly bent.
With this seal, he recites the previous fundamental recitation.
He applies it to the five parts of his body.

source_sentence: 所謂右肩左肩心喉額等項上散印。
translation: It's called the right shoulder, left shoulder, heart, throat, forehead, and other items on the upper part of the body.
Next, he makes the sign of following his heart.
He takes his right hand and spreads out his five fingers.
He bends them slightly like the shape of a lion's claw and that's it.

source_sentence: 結此印誦隨心真言七遍加持五處。
translation: He makes this seal by reciting the true words of follow-through seven times and applying them to the five places.

source_sentence: 修行者作先行成就法已。
translation: After the practitioner has accomplished the prior practice, he wants to perform the ritual to remove the poison.
When he wants to do the deed to remove the poison, he contemplates himself as a child of Rangoli.

source_sentence: 觀想自身為穰麌梨童女。
translation: He contemplates himself as a young woman named Rang stagli.
Her body is green and resembles that of a nāga.
She has seven heads and a round neck with a brilliant light.
He should contemplate four arms.

source_sentence: 右第一手持三戟叉第二手執三五莖孔雀尾。
translation: In the first hand on the right, she holds a three-pronged halberd, and in the second hand, she holds three or five peacock tails.

source_sentence: 左第一手把一黑蛇第二手施無畏。
translation: In the first hand on the left, she holds a black snake, and in the second hand, she bestows fearlessness.

source_sentence: 又想七寶瓔珞耳璫環釧。
translation: Also, think of a necklace made of seven jewels, earrings, and bracelets.
He adorns his body with arm and leg bracelets.
He also decorates his body with the snakes' necklaces.

source_sentence: 想從一一毛孔流出火焰。
translation: He imagines a flame flowing from each pore.
After observing this, he puts his fundamental seal and the seal of approval for following his heart in front of the person who's been stung.
He makes the sign of the root and the sign of following his heart.
He applies them to the five parts of his body.
Take a ripe copper bowl and fill it with water.
He recites the true chant, "Follow your heart," and applies it seven times.

source_sentence: 以右手掬水打被螫人心上。
translation: Using his right hand, he scoops up the water and strikes the person who's been stung in the heart.
All the poisonous energy will gradually disappear.

source_sentence: 即於真言句中增加此句。
translation: That's when this phrase is added to the true words.
It's called.

source_sentence: 左攞娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)尾鑠(疏覺切)娑縛(二合引)賀(引)即取淨土加持七遍。
translation: "Zola svāhā (a two-component word), ḍākin (a two-component word), svāhā (a two-component word)," which means he takes the pure land and applies seven times of blessing to it.
He surrounds the person who's been stung with it seven times.
All the poison should be destroyed at that time.
Another rule is to recite the Sanskrit letter un in front of the person who's been stung.

source_sentence: 結本印數誦吽字一字真言。
translation: He recites the one-letter true chant Un repeatedly with the original seal.

source_sentence: 或誦撲字一字真言加持。
translation: Or, he can recite the one-letter true chant Pusa and bless it.
It'll all remove the poison.
If he always adheres to this Rangoli teaching.
It'll extinguish all the poisons of the world.
Nothing that they seek will be fulfilled.
It was then that the Bhagavān spoke this sūtra.

source_sentence: 時彼大會天龍藥叉人非人等。
translation: That great assembly of gods, dragons, yakṣas, humans, and nonhumans heard what the Buddha taught, and they all rejoiced and believed it.

source_sentence: 聞佛所說皆大歡喜信受奉行。
translation: Everyone who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced greatly and faithfully accepted and approved.
Sutra of the Girl Rangdhari Spoken by the Buddha
